intro: In order to optimize our money to last for as long as possible, we must plan carefully. This is known as income planning.

subtopics.par: There are multiple approaches. Here is one scenario:
list: Let’s say your expenses are 75k for a couple in retirement. You fall in the maximal margin tax rate of 12%
Remember 12.5k per person is the standard deduction on your taxes, so it’s 25k deducted for a couple.
Remember that you don’t need to pay the FICA tax after age 65.

subtopics.par: Order of withdrawal from your retirement account
list: Only withdraw 25k from your 401k account because it is tax deducted
If you have enough, withdraw the rest from your Roth IRA or Roth 401k. But most likely, this is not viable because you may not have enough to last up to 30 years in retirement
If not, make a plan to withdraw from both your Roth and 401k, but how much in each is subjective
Consider that pulling from your Roth means you don’t pay any taxes, but holding off Roth withdrawal means your investment keeps on growing tax-free
Social Security might be completely depleted before 2040, but someone in retirement right now you can receive up to $1,800 per month.
Plan your retirement as though SS does not exist because you can't guarantee that

subtopics.par: This is another idea for having a stable retirement, but it depends on your longevity.
list: An example is you pay the insurance company 100k and then receive 25k each year after you turn 85
However, it's hard to judge how long you will live, so this is just another option to consider
